name: Vocode
headline: Open source Voice AI
description:
Open source voice AI.

Check out our docs for more information: https://docs.vocode.dev

founders.name: Kian Hooshmand, Founder
founders.description: Working on something new. Formerly @Vocode, @Brex, and Berkeley.

# [![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6234599/228339858-95a0873a-2d40-4542-963a-6358d19086f5.svg)](https://vocode.dev/<https:/user-images.githubusercontent.com/6234599/228339858-95a0873a-2d40-4542-963a-6358d19086f5.svg>) vocode
[](https://vocode.dev/<#-vocode>)
### Open source voice AI
[](https://vocode.dev/<#open-source-voice-ai>)
Build, deploy, and scale hyperrealistic voice agents.
[**Vocode Core**](https://vocode.dev/<https:/github.com/vocodedev/vocode-core>) provides the integrations, orchestration, and abstractions to create voice applications on top of any AI stack ([Docs](https://vocode.dev/<https:/docs.vocode.dev/open-source>))
[**Vocode API**](https://vocode.dev/<https:/dashboard.vocode.dev>) is an enterprise-grade API to manage AI agents on phone calls ([Docs](https://vocode.dev/<https:/docs.vocode.dev/walkthrough_intro>)) that lives on top of **Vocode Core**.
  * [Python SDK](https://vocode.dev/<https:/github.com/vocodedev/vocode-api-python>)
  * [Node SDK](https://vocode.dev/<https:/github.com/vocodedev/vocode-api-node>)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Vocode**

**Founding & Location**: Vocode was established in 2023 as part of Y Combinator's W23 batch, and is based in the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco. With a compact yet agile team of three, Vocode is poised to disrupt the voice AI industry.

**Mission**: Vocode's mission revolves around creating an open-source voice AI platform. This ethos not only encourages collaboration and innovation but sets the stage for how developers can build, deploy, and scale hyper-realistic voice agents.

**Core Product**: The centerpiece of Vocode‚Äôs offerings is the **Vocode Core**. This platform provides the necessary integrations and orchestration to build robust voice applications across various AI tech stacks. Additionally, their **Vocode API** acts as an enterprise-level tool for managing AI agents on phone calls. This flexibility and capability make it an attractive option for developers in need of sophisticated solutions.

**Key Partnerships**: The company is backed by Jared Friedman, who serves as their Group Partner at Y Combinator, facilitating connections that can accelerate their growth.

**Tags**: Vocode is categorized under several relevant industry tags including ‚Äòdeveloper-tools‚Äô, ‚Äògenerative-ai‚Äô, ‚Äòopen-source‚Äô, and ‚Äòconversational-ai‚Äô. This indicates its focus on delivering value to a wide spectrum of developers and organizations looking to harness the potential of voice technology.

**Resources & Engagement**: For more in-depth information, Vocode maintains a detailed [documentation site](https://docs.vocode.dev), alongside their main [website](https://vocode.dev). Here, users can explore features, access community support, and find resources that help leverage their platform effectively.

Vocode's commitment to open-source and its agile structure position it well for innovation within the voice AI landscape. As the tech environment continues to evolve, they are likely to become a key player in shaping how developers engage with conversational AI.
